types.RestAPI: HTTP server with authentication, validation, rate limiting, CRUD operations
types.MiddlewareComponent: HTTP request processor with specific responsibility
types.JWTToken: fields: string token with encoded claims
types.RateLimit: request count restriction per time window
types.SlidingWindow: rate limiting algorithm tracking requests over moving time period
types.APIError: fields: Code string, Message string, Details []ErrorDetail, Timestamp time.Time, RequestID string, TraceID string, Path string, Method string, StatusCode int
types.BaseResource: common fields for all API resources with ID, timestamps, version
types.User: fields: BaseResource, Email string, Username string, Password string, Role string, Status string, Profile UserProfile
types.JWTClaims: fields: Subject string, Username string, Email string, Role string, Permissions []string, IssuedAt time.Time, ExpiresAt time.Time, NotBefore time.Time, Issuer string, Audience string
types.RateLimitState: fields: SubWindowCounts []int64, WindowStart time.Time, LastUpdate time.Time, TotalRequests int64
types.ErrorDetail: fields: Field string, Code string, Message string, RejectedValue interface{}, ExpectedFormat string
types.FieldError: fields: Field string, Tag string, Value interface{}, Message string
types.FilterOptions: query parameters for resource filtering with where, orderby, limit, offset fields
types.PageResult: paginated query results with total, limit, offset, data fields
types.UserProfile: FirstName string, LastName string, PhoneNumber string, Bio string
types.RateLimiter: sliding window rate limiting with configurable policies
types.RateLimitResult: fields: Allowed bool, RequestsUsed int64, RequestsLimit int64, WindowReset time.Time, RetryAfter time.Duration, AppliedPolicy string, Headers map[string]string
types.CircuitBreaker: fields: mu sync.RWMutex, state CircuitBreakerState, failures int64, lastFailTime time.Time
types.CachedRepository: base Repository, cache Cache, ttl time.Duration

methods.authenticate(token) returns: validates JWT token and returns user context
methods.validateInput(request) returns: checks request against schema and business rules
methods.checkRateLimit(clientID) returns: determines if client can make request
methods.handleCRUD(operation, resource) returns: processes create, read, update, delete operations
methods.SetPassword(password) error: hashes and sets user password with bcrypt
methods.NewBaseResource(createdBy) BaseResource: creates base resource with generated ID
methods.PrepareForUpdate(updatedBy): updates timestamp, version, and updatedBy fields
methods.SoftDelete(): marks resource as deleted without removal
methods.IsDeleted() bool: returns true if resource is soft deleted
methods.IsAccountLocked() bool: checks if user account is temporarily locked
methods.RecordFailedLogin(): increments failed attempts and potentially locks account
methods.ShouldResetWindow(windowSize) bool: determines if rate limit window should reset
methods.NewValidationError(requestID, fieldError: creates APIError for validation failures with field details
methods.WriteErrorResponse(w, apiError, statusCo: writes structured error response to HTTP with proper headers and logging
methods.NewSanitizer() returns: creates sanitizer with compiled security patterns
methods.SanitizeString(input) returns: removes dangerous content from string input
methods.ValidateStruct(ctx, data) returns: performs complete validation on struct with sanitization
methods.ValidateJSON(ctx, jsonData, target) retu: validates JSON input against schema and business rules
methods.ValidateUserCreation(ctx, user) returns: checks business rules for new user creation
methods.ValidateUserUpdate(ctx, userID, updates): checks business rules for user updates
methods.ValidateResourceOwnership(ctx, userID, r: ensures user can modify specified resource
methods.ValidationMiddleware(validator) returns: creates HTTP middleware for request validation
methods.GenerateAccessToken(user) returns: creates JWT token with user claims and expiration
methods.ValidateAccessToken(tokenString) returns: parses and validates JWT token returning claims
methods.RequireAuthentication(next) returns: middleware that validates JWT and adds user context
methods.RequirePermission(permission) returns: middleware that checks user has specific permission
methods.HasPermission(userRole, userPermissions,: checks if user has required permission through role or explicit grant
methods.ValidateResourceOwnership(userID, userRo: checks if user can access specific resource instance
methods.CheckRateLimit(ctx, clientID, clientRole: determines if client can make request and updates counters
methods.GetRateLimitState(ctx, clientID) returns: retrieves current rate limit state for client
methods.CalculateSlidingWindowCount(state, now): computes request count within sliding window
methods.BuildRateLimitHeaders(result) returns: creates HTTP headers for rate limit communication
methods.CleanupExpiredEntries() returns: removes old entries to prevent memory leaks
methods.Build(handler) returns: creates final HTTP handler with all middleware applied
methods.NewErrorHandler(logger) returns: creates error handler with structured logging capabilities
methods.NewRecoveryMiddleware(errorHandler, enab: creates panic recovery middleware with error handling
methods.NewCircuitBreaker(threshold, timeout) re: creates circuit breaker for automatic error recovery
methods.Execute(ctx, fn) returns: runs function with circuit breaker protection and failure tracking
methods.NewTestDatabase(ctx, t) returns: creates fresh PostgreSQL container for testing
methods.LoadFixtures(fixtures) returns: inserts test data from fixture definitions
methods.CreateToken(userType) returns: generates valid JWT token for specified test user
methods.CreateExpiredToken(userType) returns: generates expired JWT token for testing token validation

constants.SLIDING_WINDOW_SIZE: time duration for rate limiting window
constants.RoleAdmin: admin user role with full permissions
constants.RoleUser: standard user role with own-resource permissions
constants.RoleService: service account role for system operations

terms.production-grade API: REST API with security, validation, rate limiting, monitoring
terms.middleware pipeline: chain of request processors handling authentication and authorization
terms.code-first: API design starting with implementation code
terms.schema-first: API design starting with OpenAPI specification
terms.request lifecycle: complete flow of HTTP request through system components
terms.soft deletion: marking records as deleted without physical removal
terms.sliding window algorithm: rate limiting using moving time windows
terms.schema validation: verifying data matches expected structure and types
terms.business rule validation: enforcing domain-specific constraints beyond basic schema
terms.security sanitization: removing or neutralizing potentially dangerous content
terms.input validation: comprehensive checking of all incoming data
terms.validation layers: multiple stages of input checking with different purposes
terms.error response design: structured format for validation failure communication
terms.field-level validation: checking individual fields against specific rules
terms.sanitization context: applying appropriate cleaning based on data usage
terms.JWT tokens: self-contained authentication tokens with encoded claims
terms.role-based access control: authorization system using user roles and permissions
terms.token refresh mechanism: secure exchange of refresh tokens for new access tokens
terms.permission hierarchy: structured permission system with role-based inheritance
terms.resource ownership validation: checking user access rights to specific resource instances
terms.bearer token authentication: HTTP authorization using Authorization Bearer header
terms.token bucket: rate limiting algorithm using refillable token capacity
terms.fixed window: rate limiting algorithm with discrete time intervals
terms.rate limit headers: HTTP headers communicating rate limit status to clients
terms.burst protection: preventing sudden spikes in request volume
terms.distributed rate limiting: coordinating rate limits across multiple server instances
terms.graceful degradation: maintaining service availability during infrastructure failures
terms.structured error propagation: consistent error classification and formatting across components
terms.context passing: sharing data between components through request context
terms.error classification: categorizing errors by type for appropriate handling
terms.centralized error formatting: shared error response structure across all endpoints
terms.nested middleware: middleware components wrapping each other in sequence
terms.error context enrichment: adding relevant debugging information to errors
terms.asynchronous notification: non-blocking event handling for secondary operations
terms.error recovery strategies: mechanisms for handling and recovering from various failure conditions
terms.circuit breaker: automatic failure detection and recovery mechanism
terms.compensating actions: operations that undo effects of failed multi-step processes
terms.edge cases: unusual situations and boundary conditions requiring special handling
terms.test pyramid: testing strategy with unit tests at base, integration in middle, e2e at top
terms.milestone checkpoints: validation steps and expected behavior after each milestone
terms.unit tests: isolated testing of individual functions and methods
terms.integration tests: testing of component interactions and boundaries
terms.end-to-end tests: complete workflow testing from user perspective
terms.test doubles: mock objects and test implementations for isolation
terms.fixture data: predefined test data for consistent test scenarios
terms.load testing: performance validation under realistic traffic volumes
terms.stress testing: system behavior validation under excessive load conditions
terms.error injection: deliberate failure simulation for resilience testing
terms.concurrent access testing: validation of data consistency under simultaneous operations
terms.security boundary testing: validation that security controls cannot be bypassed
terms.test coverage: measurement of code exercised by test suite
terms.test isolation: preventing test interference through independent execution
terms.structured logging: logging with consistent format and request correlation
terms.request correlation: tracking single request through all system components
terms.performance bottleneck: system component limiting overall throughput or response time
terms.distributed tracing: tracking request flow across service boundaries
terms.performance baseline: expected response times and throughput under normal conditions
terms.component-level performance: measuring processing time within individual system components
terms.horizontal scaling: adding more server instances to handle increased load
terms.load balancing: distributing requests across multiple server instances
terms.caching layer: temporary data storage to improve performance
terms.observability: comprehensive system monitoring and analysis capabilities
terms.GitOps: deployment strategy using Git as source of truth
